glosses: Suffix of verb "to be" for subject "you" (informal).

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish ـسڭ (-sin), from Old Anatolian Turkish [script needed] (-sen, -sin, -san, -sın), ultimately from Proto-Turkic *sen. Cognate with Azerbaijani -sən. Compare -im (“first-person singular suffix”) from Proto-Common Turkic *ben (see ben (“I”)).
